user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_new_user_entry:
```c
static int
add_new_user_entry (const char *const username,
                    const char *const password,
                    const char *const realm,
                    int allow_area_1,
                    int allow_area_2)
{
  struct UserEntry *entry;
  enum MHD_Result res;

  if ((sizeof(user_ids) / sizeof(user_ids[0])) <= user_ids_used)
    return 0; /* No more space to add new entry */

  entry = user_ids + user_ids_used;

  entry->username = username;
  entry->realm = realm;

  res = MHD_YES;

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_md5,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_md5));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_md5,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_md5));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_sha256,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha256));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha512_256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha512_256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res =
      MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                       username,
                                       realm,
                                       password,
                                       entry->userdigest_sha512_256,
                                       sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha512_256));

  if (MHD_NO == res)
    return 0; /* Failure exit point */

  entry->allow_area_1 = allow_area_1;
  entry->allow_area_2 = allow_area_2;

  user_ids_used++;

  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the entire function: there are no calls to memcmp, and no other code that uses memcmp to compare null‑terminated strings. The code only assigns pointer values (entry->username = username; entry->realm = realm;), performs integer checks and calls MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash / MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest. None of these statements are memcmp usages comparing NUL-terminated strings. If further investigation is required of the digest helper functions (MHD_digest_auth_calc_...), those are external to this fragment and would need to be inspected separately for any internal memcmp usage; within this provided code there are no occurrences of memcmp or equivalent misuse to flag.
